i am so not prepared for this!


oh well its time.

~do you ever listen to a song over and over again till it almost seems unreal?

~how come everyone always thinks songs were written about their lives, when they were clearly written about mine?

~my parents had their 35th wedding anniversary today. i'm really proud to say that. i'm not sure why, but i am.

~you know when people do little things that just make you unbelievably happy? like letting you in on little exciting parts of their lives. that makes me really happy. thanks for letting me be a part of it.

~my whole life i always had a best friend, but i was never theirs. i like that i know who my best friend is now and that the feeling is mutual.

~i just realized what i did to you. i'm so sorry.

~i like going to the honda dealership because all the guys there think i'm pretty. i don't usually get that.

~i wish i was better at argueing.
~and spelling.

~i can't remember if i never wanted to get married really young or if i feel that way because of my friends...either way.

~i really like having a guy as one of my bestfriends. for some reason i feel like that is one of my most adult and important relationships.

~you can never have too many little black dresses...i agree with that.

~my 25 year old bald cat that used to sleep in an old frying pan just passed. he was a pain in the ass. i miss him.

~where do you think we'll all be in 10 years? will we be too grown up for livejournal and myspace? i don't plan on growing up.

~i should go to bed...all this thinking is what keeps me awake. goodnight. its 6:13am

10 annonymous statements (which everyone will probably be able to guess)

1. i wish you could see yourself the way i see you.
2. no one has ever made me laugh harder or cry harder, and i miss you. and i consider myself very lucky to have had you in my life.
3. i love you, but i talk shit when i'm around you, and it scares me that i can be like that.
4. i admire you more than you will ever know.
5. you are one of the most talented people i have ever known. and because of this i'm ok with the fact that i wasn't as good as you.
6. you fulfilled a role in my life that i always needed and never had. and for that i can't thank you enough.
7. please go through with it...for your sake, follow through.
8. you deserve what you want, i'm sorry i can't give that to you.
9. you've really surprised me and impressed me.
10. you're one of a kind and i wish i could be more like you.
i feel scared and confused and overwhealmed. i sound like an "aks gary" comersial, but this is how i feel, and i'm not sure why...i feel like i'm constantly out of breath...
running out of gas = sucky...really sucky!

so its been about 4 months since i've written anything...
but i just wanted to share that states was once again amazing and every one who competed did an amazing job and it was so fun being there with all of you!

also prom was incredible and our group was pretty much the best...not forgetting uncle reggie because he was a beast of a limo driver! every one looked amazing and i was so lucky to have such a perfect date to the dance. i hope you had fun at your prom eric...i know i did and i love you!!!
and to all the seniors i hope you had a wonderful night that you will always remember i'm glad i got to be a part of it :-)
xoxoxo, dc

Little Known Christmas Fact

Not long ago and far away, Santa was getting ready for his annual trip...but there were problems everywhere.

Four of his elves were sick, and the trainee elves did not produce the toys as fast as the regular ones so Santa was beginning to feel the pressure of being behind schedule.

Then Mrs. Claus told Santa that her mom was coming to visit. This stressed Santa even more. When he went to harness the reindeer, he found that three of them were about to give birth and two had jumped the fence and were out, heaven knows where. More Stress. Then when he began to load the sleigh, one of the boards cracked and the toy bag fell to the ground and scattered the toys. So, frustrated, Santa went into the house for a cup of coffee and a shot of whiskey. When he went to the cupboard, he found the elves had hidden the liquor and there was nothing to drink. In his frustration, he dropped the coffee pot and it broke into hundreds of little pieces all over the he kitchen floor.

He went to get the broom and found that mice had eaten the straw it was made from.

Just then the doorbell rang and Santa cussed on his way to the door. He opened the door and there was a little angel with a great big Christmas tree. The angel said: "Where would you like to put this tree Santa?"

And that my friends, is how the little angel came to be on top of the Christmas tree.
 
i hope every one has a wonderful holiday. I love you!!!

xoxo,dc

Pillsbury Doughboy Dies

It is with the saddest heart that I must pass on the following news:

Please join me in remembering a great icon of the entertainment community. The Pillsbury Doughboy died yesterday of a yeast infection and complications from repeated pokes in the belly. He was 71. Doughboy was buried in a lightly greased coffin. Dozens of celebrities turned out to pay their respects, including Mrs. Butterworth, Hungry Jack, the California Raisins, Betty Crocker, the Hostess Twinkies and Captain Crunch. The grave site was piled high with flours. Aunt Jemima delivered the eulogy and lovingly described Doughboy as a man who never knew how much he was kneaded. Doughboy rose quickly in show business, but his later life was filled with turnovers. He was not considered a very smart cookie, wasting much of his dough on half-baked schemes. Despite being a little flaky at times, he still, as a crusty old man, was considered a roll model for millions. Doughboy is survived by his wife, Play Dough; two children John Dough and Jane Dough; plus they have one in the oven. He is also survived by his elderly father Pop Tart. The funeral was held at 3:50 for about 20 minutes.

I'm really glad that most of our problems are being resolved. I think now we may be able to begin working back up to the drama that we all know and love...with out the drama. I guess i always under estimated "talking", it helps a lot in the long run, and is really the only fair way to resolve somthing. I guess i've been a sort of hypocrite from that standpoint. my advice to people with problems was to always confront the other party, talk it over, if they listen and you listen most likely things will be resolved. right? maybe i never actually beleived the advice that i, myself was dishing out to others. but, i do now...i know what i feel like now that i've talked, and i have the feeling that life, in general, is going to be getting alot better... for everyone. so to every one who i have ever told "just talk to them, and it will be ok", my advice to you does not change, the only differenc is i now believe it myself. Thankyou to those of you who made me realize my own advice, by giving it back to me; and to those of you whose confrontations are not yet solved..."just talk to them and every thing will be ok."...i honestly mean it this time.
love, dc

To everyone who has had a bad day...think about it this way...

"If today was perfect there would be no need for tomorrow."
~unknown

Slow Dance 
Have you ever watched kids
on a merry-go-round
Or listened to the rain
slapping on the ground?

Ever followed a butterfly's erratic flight
Or gazed at the sun into the fading night?

You better slow down
Don't dance so fast
Time is short
The music won't last

Do you run through each day on the fly
When you ask "How are you?"
do you hear the reply?

When the day is done,
do you lie in your bed
With the next hundred chores
running through your head?

You'd better slow down
Don't dance so fast
Time is short
The music won't last

Ever told your child,
We'll do it tomorrow
And in your haste, not see his sorrow?

Ever lost touch,
Let a good friendship die
'Cause you never had time
to call and say "Hi"?

You'd better slow down
Don't dance so fast
Time is short
The music won't last

When you run so fast to get somewhere
You miss half the fun of getting there.

When you worry and hurry through your day,
It is like an unopened gift....
Thrown away...

Life is not a race.
Do take it slower
Hear the music
Before the song is over.

I love you all and even thought this happiness may wear off in a little while i'm  going to enjoy it while it lasts because lifes too short to focus on the negetive. I love you all with all my heart!
dc

    eric, you are not only my boyfriend you are also my bestfriend  and you always will be. you are the greatest guy i have ever known and i am so lucky to have you! i love you and i will always be here for you no matter what.
    ryne, you are fun and amazing and i am soooo glad that we have gotten to be really good friends. i love you sir. i cherish every flip flop fight we have. 
    Olivia, you are gorgeos, sweet, kind, and amazing. ummmm i think you should move in with me and just stay with me for the remainder of highschool!
    clairance, i love you too, now sober up! lol
    maddi, you are beautiful and i love ya to death, were you this amazing in middle school and i some how just over looked it. i'm sorry but im glad i see it now because you are amazing!
    justin, you are so creative and tallented, that website is rediculous! i love it and i love you!
    taytay, you crack me up! you are so great and i'm so glad that we brought you into all this crazy drama this year. i love ya.
    haley, you are gorgeous and i would kill to look half as good as you every day! i love you ma'am!
    mara, you deserved that part, you know how amazing i think you are! i love you.
    paige, you are beautiful, funny, and a crazy driver and i love ya. 
    meagen, you are wonderful and beautiful and the sweetest person ever and i love you soooo much!
Ok who am i kidding...that was a list if i've ever seen one! oh well i figure people can never get too many complements! i mean them all and i love you all and anyone i left out im sorry its been a long day and im tired! muah!
: ) dc

to all my best friends, you know who you are,


I can't give solutions to all of life's problems, doubts, or fears.
but I can listen to you, and together we will search for answers.

I can't change your past with all it's heartache and pain, 
nor the future with its untold stories.
But i can be there now when you need me to care.

I can't keep your feet from stumbling.
I can only offer my hand that you may grasp it and not fall.

Your joys, triumphs, successes, and happiness are not mine; 
yet i can share in your laughter. 

Your decisions in life are not mine to make, nor to judge;
I can only support you, encourage you,
and help you when you ask.

I can't prevent you from falling away from friendship,
from you values, from me.
I can only pray for you, talk to you, and wait for you. 

I can't give you boundaries which i have determined for you,
 But I can give you the room to change, room to grow,
room to be yourself.

I can't keep your heart from breaking and hurting,
But i can cry with you and help you pick up the pieces
and put them back in place.

I can't tell you who you are.
I can only love you and be your friend.
-unknown

I'm sorry to anyone that i have hurt, i would never intentionally do that. i love you all very much. i hope that every one feels better and know that i am always here for you know matter what.
love,dc

Its 8:15 am, thats incredibly early for me on a saturday! last night we went and saw forbidden broadway, and it was hysterical, oh it was so great! the theatre probably only sat like 50 people and the stage was really small and close! so besides the fact that we had one of those 9 yr. old kids be hind us that didn't understand anything and kept asking questions, it was pretty incredible. tonight were going to see putnum county spelling bee! and i'm really excited! bunny, i'm still scoping out fountains but we will find the perfect one i have no doubt about it, i miss you ma'am. I walked around nyu yesterday and i'm going back today for  the open house so that i can right this trip off as school business. walking around nyu reminded me of eric, i saw some of the director students there and he would fit in perfectly. this both made me sad and happy. sad well we all know why it makes me sad...it makes every one else sad too that he'll be leaving but  it also made me incredibly happy that he'll have such a wonderful time and so many oportunities in college! ...wow! that got really sappy really fast!lol! i don't even know how that happened. closing night of the show kids, have fun and milk it for all its worth! oh i forgot my uncles company is doing work in studio 54 (thats a theatre that used to be a night club)and i got to stand on this huge broadway stage while they were striking the set of a street car named desire. that was pretty amazing it gave me goose bumps...us theatre kids are so easily entertained. ok....now im done. i love and miss you all and i'll see you soon.
dc

Sooooooooo....i don't even know what im feeling at the moment. I studied so hard for my algebra 2 hon. exam and lets just say my grade wasn't cute. i promised myself that i wouldn't look this weekend while i was in new york but obviously i lied. Oh well...i cried and now i'm over it. On the bright side i am in newyork! i'm staying with my aunt and uncle, who are probably the coolest people ever... there like big kids! we're going into the city tomorrow and trying to get tickets to "rent" or "forbidden broadway" either of which would be amazing! Then on saturday i'm going to NYU's open house so that i can right this trip off as school business and then that night i'm going to see "the putnum county spelling bee" ahhhhhh i'm pretty excited! I'll be home on sunday. As amazing as it is to be in new york, i really miss eric, i feel like i haven't seen him in like two weeks...oh wait thats cause i haven't. lol. we have both been gone the past two weekends, so i hope that next weekend we can actually spend some time together cause i really miss being with him! congrats to all the barefoot people, i heard you did wondurfully. some one get a bootleg copy for me so that i can see it. lol. break a leg on the next two nights and have fun. Bunny, cheer up darling, i love you and i miss you and i'm going to try to find us a fountain to dance in in NYC! ROAD TRIP!!!!!!!!!! we're doin it. every one have a fabulous weekend and i'm going to also because ya know what i don't give a damn about my algebra two exam, I studied, i tried, i suck at math, and theres nothing i can do about that now! so i'm going into new york city and getting mugged and dancing in fountains and drinking lots of coffee damn it! whooooo ok i'm done. i love you all and i'll see you soon. 
love, dc

So I too now have a live journal. i held out as long as i could but since i was left as the only teenager in the world that did not have one it seems i hadno other choice. Thanks to bunny for helping ...actually for completely making my entire live journal for me. I love you darling! So i'm seriously stressing out about exams, ya know since i have absolutly no idea what i'm doing in chemistry or algebra! Ahhhhhhh i just need for the next week to be over. Oh well i'm not even going to worry about it. I'm really happy that every one is starting to get along again. Its a scary thought all of us fighting. But we all love each other (probably too much)and we will ALL be fine! So i hope that every one has a fabulous weekend since i will be in a corner studying the whole time. :( lol.
